Misprision.definition: neglectful or wrongful performance of an official duty 2
Misprision.origin: [Anglo-French, error, wrongdoing, from Old French, from mesprendre to make a mistake, from mes- wrongly + prendre to take, from Latin prehendere to seize]

1.definition: neglectful or wrongful performance of an official duty

2.definition: a clerical error in a legal proceeding that can be corrected in a summary proceeding

3.definition: the concealment of a treason or felony and failure to report it to the prosecuting authorities by a person who has not committed it [ of felony] [ of treason]
